intro: Cephalanthera falcata var. flava, commonly known as the yellow tailed orchid, is a species of orchid native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its distinctive yellow-green to orange-yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has a rhizomatous root system and is often found in shaded, moist woodland habitats. Its leaves are lance-shaped and typically arranged in a basal rosette. The orchid is noted for its fragrant flowers and is considered a rare and protected species in many regions.
